title: Bulk Player Name Upload & Blue/Orange Professional UI Theme for Teams

requirements.text: Add a bulk player name upload feature to the Teams page. Users must be able to paste a newline-separated or comma-separated list of player names into a text area, or upload a plain-text (.txt) or CSV file, and have all valid names added as players to the selected team in one action. Each parsed name should be validated (non-empty, not duplicate within the team, team does not exceed 11 players). Show a preview of parsed names before confirming, and display a summary of how many players were added or skipped with reasons.

quotes: add option to upload name in bulk for team

acceptanceCriteria: A 'Bulk Add Players' button or section is visible on the Teams page within the player management area of each team.
Users can paste a list of player names (newline or comma separated) into a textarea.
Users can upload a .txt or .csv file and have its contents parsed into individual player names.
A preview list of parsed names is shown before the user confirms the bulk add.
Names that would exceed the 11-player limit, are duplicates, or are empty are flagged and skipped.
After confirmation, all valid names are added as players to the team via the existing addPlayer backend calls.
A summary message is displayed showing how many players were added and how many were skipped with reasons.
The bulk upload UI does not break the existing individual player-add flow.

requirements.text: Retheme the entire app UI from the current cricket-green/cream palette to a professional blue and orange color scheme. Primary backgrounds and headers should use deep navy/dark blue tones. Accent colors, highlights, active states, buttons, and key data values should use bold orange. Neutral surfaces should use light grey-white. Update Tailwind config color tokens, CSS custom properties in index.css, and all component-level color classes (Teams page, BottomTabNavigation, Layout header, scoring dashboard, scorecard, match history, match setup, rules page, and modals) to consistently reflect the new blue-and-orange palette. Typography, spacing, and layout density should be refined to feel more professional and polished — clean sans-serif body text, sharp card borders, elevated shadows, and well-defined section hierarchy.

quotes: change the team of the UI make it Blue and orange and more professional

acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer uses cricket-green or cream as primary colors anywhere in the UI.
Deep navy/dark blue is used as the primary background and header color throughout all pages.
Bold orange is consistently applied to active tab indicators, primary action buttons, score highlights, and key stat values.
Neutral light grey-white surfaces are used for cards and secondary backgrounds.
The Tailwind config and CSS custom properties are updated so the new tokens drive the entire theme.
BottomTabNavigation active state uses orange highlight on a dark blue bar.
All modals (WicketModal, EndOfInningsModal, EndOfOverModal, ConfigureTournamentRulesModal) use the new blue/orange palette.
The live scoring dashboard retains high contrast and compact data density using the new palette.
Cards and sections across all pages have clean borders, elevated shadows, and well-defined hierarchy.
No component still references old green or cream color classes as primary theme colors.

constraints: Do not modify any file under frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, or frontend/src/components/ui.
Bulk player upload must reuse existing addPlayer backend calls — no new backend endpoints are required for the upload itself.
The 11-player maximum per team must be enforced during bulk upload.
nonGoals: No changes to backend data models or Motoko actor logic for the UI retheme.
No changes to the cricket rules content or tournament rules logic.
No new backend endpoints specifically for bulk upload — parsing and validation is frontend-only.
No changes to match scoring logic, live scoring dashboard functionality, or scorecard calculations.
